# Colours

All the Church Army colours, wrapped in prefixed functions.

```{r examples-ca-colours}
#' ca_purple()
```


```{r funciton-ca_cols}

colours <- c(
  black      = ca_black(),
  white      = ca_white(),
  orange     = ca_orange(),
  gold       = ca_gold(),
  green      = ca_green(),
  maroon     = ca_maroon(),
  cyan       = ca_cyan(),
  purple     = ca_purple(),
  light_teal = ca_light_teal(),
  dark_teal  = ca_dark_teal(),
  brown      = ca_brown()
)

get_cols <- function(x) colours[x]

fix_col_name <- function(x){
  stringr::str_replace(x, "_", "-") |>
    stringr::str_replace("[:space:]", "-")
}

#' Get church army colours by name
#'
#' @param x A character vector. Values must all be in \link[carutools]{ca_sample_cols}
#' @returns A character vector
#' @export
ca_cols <- function(x){
  x <- fix_col_name(x)
  stopifnot(all(x %in% names(colours)))

  out <- get_cols(x)

  return(out)
}
```
